program_metadata.program_name: Chief Data and AI Officer (CDAIO) Program

schools: Michigan Ross School of Business Executive Education

cost.notes: Exclusive of any taxes, subject to change

additional_roles: C-suite executives responsible for AI and digital strategies

curriculum_structure.overview: Four strategic core modules delivered via live faculty-led sessions

modules.module_name: AI Strategy Foundations: Building Data-Driven Advantage
learning_objectives: Align AI initiatives with business objectives

modules.module_name: AI for Business Impact: Driving Strategy and Innovation
Trusted AI: Securing Data and Scaling Analytics
learning_objectives: Extract actionable insights through advanced analytics
Support business objectives while maintaining regulatory standards
Implement trusted and ethical AI systems

modules.module_name: AI Leadership Immersion: Transforming Strategy and Influence
topics: Site visits to leading tech companies
learning_objectives: Manage organizational change in AI adoption
Equip organizations to thrive in dynamic business environments
Network with industry leaders and peers
special_features: Site visits to leading tech companies
Direct engagement with Michigan AI researchers

capstone_project.name: AI Leadership Capstone Project
capstone_project.description: Real-world AI and data challenge focused on participants' organizations
capstone_project.deliverable: Strategic roadmap applying program learnings to actual business challenges
capstone_project.methodology: Apply insights from business case simulations and practical frameworks
capstone_project.duration: Spans multiple modules (exact timeline not specified)

features: Real-time discussions on current AI applications

case_studies.description: Business case studies focused on real-world AI and data challenges
case_studies.integration: Used throughout modules and in capstone project

simulations.purpose: Replicate real-world scenarios to practice learning

capstone_project.focus: Real AI leadership challenge in participant's organization

on_campus_immersion.location: Ann Arbor, Michigan (Ross School of Business + College of Engineering)
activities: Site visits to leading tech companies
Direct engagement with Michigan AI researchers
Intensive networking with peers and faculty

faculty_engagement.access: Direct access to University of Michigan faculty

graded_assignments.details: Emeritus delivers programs with graded assignments (specific details not publicly available)

capstone_project.description: Final strategic roadmap for real-world AI challenge

certificate_requirements: Fully participate in on-campus week (5 days)

prerequisites.work_experience: Senior executive or C-suite level experience (implied)
prerequisites.prior_knowledge: Understanding of business strategy and operations (implied)
prerequisites.notes: Designed for executives already in or aspiring to C-suite data/AI roles

tools_and_software.notes: Likely includes access to AI tools and analytics platforms during program

internet_requirements.bandwidth: Stable internet connection for live streaming (assumed)

certificate.name: Chief Data and AI Officer Certificate

potential_benefits: University of Michigan alumni network access (potential)
alumni_access.notes: Standard U-M alumni benefits include UCAN (University Career Alumni Network), Career Design Fellowship, and continuing education discounts

ceus.notes: University of Michigan offers CEUs for some programs, but not confirmed for CDAIO

accreditation.specific_accreditation: NOT SPECIFIED FOR THIS EXECUTIVE PROGRAM

program_directors.name: Brad Killaly
program_directors.title: Faculty Director, CDAIO Program
program_directors.school: Ross School of Business, University of Michigan

program_directors.name: Jenna Wiens, PhD
program_directors.title: Technical Faculty Advisor, CDAIO Program
program_directors.position: Associate Professor of Computer Science and Engineering
program_directors.school: College of Engineering, University of Michigan

additional_faculty.name: M.S. Krishnan
additional_faculty.title: Accenture Professor of Computer Information Systems

additional_faculty.name: Eric Schwartz
additional_faculty.title: Professor
additional_faculty.expertise: Customer behavior prediction, customer relationship management

additional_faculty.name: Brian Denton
additional_faculty.title: Stephen M. Pollock Collegiate Professor of Industrial and Operations Engineering

additional_faculty.name: Hyun-soo Ahn
additional_faculty.title: Professor of Technology and Operations, Ford Motor Company Business Co-Director of the Joel D. Tauber Institute for Global Operations

external_practitioners.details: Sessions delivered by both University of Michigan faculty and external industry practitioners

key_outcomes: Develop and lead AI-driven business strategies
Leverage emerging technologies (GenAI, analytics) for competitive advantage
Ensure data security and regulatory compliance
Extract actionable insights through advanced analytics
Manage organizational change in AI adoption
Build executive influence in AI leadership

networking.peer_network: Global cohort of C-suite executives and AI leaders
networking.faculty_access: Direct engagement with top Michigan faculty and AI researchers
networking.industry_connections: Site visits and workshops with leading tech companies
networking.alumni_network: Access to University of Michigan alumni community (potential)

innovation_access.labs: Access to University of Michigan innovation labs
innovation_access.research: Engagement with cutting-edge AI research at Michigan
innovation_access.companies: Site visits to leading technology companies

career_impact: Equip for C-suite data and AI leadership roles
Gain competitive advantage through AI expertise
Position as thought leader in AI and digital transformation
